item.title: Democrat politicians always call for "investigations"...

Abolish ICE Denver

Democrat politicians always call for "investigations" and "studies" to silence and tire activists. Calling for an investigation into police murder is the Dem Party equivalent of "thoughts and prayers."

We will not take down these watered-down concessions from Dems! Elijah's mother wants these cops and paramedics PROSECUTED

Abolish ICE Denver

Glendale Police Department (Colorado) murdered an unresponsive man likely sleeping in his car nearly two weeks ago and there has been very little media coverage or community response. Rest in power, John Pachaeco Jr!

Denver Police said the man was "unresponsive," but haven't said why officers fired their weapons.

9news.com

Little information released nearly a week after Glendale Police shot and killed a man on Colorado Boulevard

item.title: On June 25, under the pressure of mass protests against racist...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

On June 25, under the pressure of mass protests against racist police killings, Governor Jared Polis issued an executive order which would open an independent investigation into Elijah McClain‚Äôs death, led by state Attorney General Phil Weiser. This was after Aurora District Attorney Dave Young declined to file any charges against the killers, then the city of Aurora opened a sham investigation led by a former cop which was terminated because it was plainly not ‚Äúindependent‚Äù.... Now it is up to Phil Weiser to decide whether the cops and paramedics responsible for Elijah‚Äôs death will face any criminal charges.

But just this week, Governor Polis quietly loosened the scope of the investigation, allowing Weiser to investigate for ‚Äúoffenses‚Äù, not just ‚Äúcriminal activity‚Äù related to Elijah‚Äôs death, opening up the possibility for him to come back with watered down charges against the killers, like we saw in Breonna Taylor‚Äôs case. Polis also took out the words that suggest someone caused the death of Elijah McClain.

Polis must think that the movement isn‚Äôt paying attention, that we‚Äôve been subdued by the repressive arrests of movement leaders, and now he can reel back his investigation without opposition in the streets. He is wrong.

Join us for an emergency action to make it clear that we are still here and we are not going anywhere until we get justice for Elijah McClain!

MASKS REQUIRED (OVER YOUR NOSE & MOUTH!) & PLEASE KEEP DISTANCE BETWEEN YOURSELF AND OTHERS.

See More

SAT, NOV 21

EMERGENCY ACTION: Eyes on Weiser! Justice for Elijah McClain!

Colorado State Capitol

item.title: This is a blatant display of the hyper-exploitation of immigrant...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

This is a blatant display of the hyper-exploitation of immigrant workers. A recent lawsuit alleges that managers at Tyson placed bets on how many workers would contract COVID-19 while working and ordered workers to continue working-- even while symptomatic.

A lawsuit claims that Tyson Foods ordered employees to work during the pandemic while managers privately wagered money on how many of them would contract COVID-19.

iowacapitaldispatch.com

Lawsuit: Tyson managers bet money on how many workers would contract COVID-19 - Iowa Capital Dispatch

A lawsuit claims that Tyson Foods ordered employees to work during the pandemic while managers privately wagered money on how many of them would contract COVID-19.A lawsuit claims that Tyson Foods ordered employees to work during the pandemic while managers privately wagered money on how many of them would contract COVID-19.

item.title: "For the second time in four years, fears that a Democrat...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"For the second time in four years, fears that a Democrat would be elected president sent private prison stocks plummeting earlier this month. To the casual observer, the prospect of President-elect Joe Biden‚Äîwho promised to ‚Äústop corporations from profiteering from incarceration‚Äù‚Äîpresented an existential threat to the multi-billion dollar industry.This article was published in partnership with Slate.But the big players in private prisons, CoreCivic and Geo Group, are not pan...icking‚Äîand rumors of their impending demise have been exaggerated. That‚Äôs because they‚Äôve been steadily diversifying, placing their bets on a future that includes revenue from commercial real estate, electronic monitoring, and halfway houses.

On a quarterly earnings call just two days after the election, CoreCivic CEO Damon Hininger was asked about the possibility that a Biden administration may end the company‚Äôs contracts with the federal Bureau of Prisons. He replied confidently, ‚ÄúWe think our risk is pretty minimal there.‚Äù He noted that back in 2010, the agency accounted for 15 percent of the company‚Äôs revenue. Today it‚Äôs just 2 percent.The companies still care which party controls the government: A Newsweek analysis of political contributions from GEO and CoreCivic‚Äôs political action committees found that both heavily favored Republicans in political donations during the 2020 cycle. About 95 percent of GEO‚Äôs nearly $1 million in donations went to GOP candidates and the party, as did more than 87 percent of CoreCivic‚Äôs $181,000."

See MoreCoreCivic and GEO Group have been shifting away from prisons toward other government contracts, like office space and immigration detention.

themarshallproject.org

Think Private Prison Companies Are Going Away Under Biden? They Have Other Plans

CoreCivic and GEO Group have been shifting away from prisons toward other government contracts, like office space and immigration detention.CoreCivic and GEO Group have been shifting away from prisons toward other government contracts, like office space and immigration detention.
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: "In a sweeping change to its immigration practices, Mexico...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"In a sweeping change to its immigration practices, Mexico has stopped holding migrant children and their families in detention centers, bowing to international pressure from human rights groups that criticized the practice as inhumane.

The reform, which took effect this week, also gives migrant children temporary legal status in Mexico in order to avoid immediate deportation and allow time for them to seek legal avenues for staying in the country.

[...]

...

Mexico‚Äôs immigration agency, which runs detention centers, opposed the reform [...]"

See MoreThe United Nations said the reform is an 'historic advance' in human rights

vice.com

Migrant Children Will No Longer Be Held in Detention in Mexico

The United Nations said the reform is an 'historic advance' in human rightsThe United Nations said the reform is an 'historic advance' in human rights

item.title: Abolish ICE DenverShowing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denverüì£Call To Actionüì£ Contact Your Denver City Council people (including...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE DenverShowing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

üì£Call To Actionüì£

Contact Your Denver City Council people (including At-Large - Ortega & Kniech) and ask:

‚Ä¢ What is the status of collective bargaining with Denv...er Police Dept?
‚Ä¢ Will you commit to allow the police contract to go to arbitration?
‚Ä¢ Will you commit to no raises for DPD?

DEMAND - no new raises for Denver Police Department!

A 2-year contract with DPD is not just irresponsible, it is immoral. The current contract allows DPD to lock in a $5M raise in 2022 while no other city employees are allowed to collectively bargain AND face drastic cuts to their agency budgets. The 2021 budget includes minor increases to programs designed as alternatives to policing (STAR, etc.) with funding from external sources ‚Äì these budgetary increases did not decrease the DPD budget in any way.

Tell your councilperson to stand firm and say NO to this contract!

item.title: On June 25, under the pressure of mass protests against racist...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

On June 25, under the pressure of mass protests against racist police killings, Governor Jared Polis issued an executive order which would open an independent investigation into Elijah McClain‚Äôs death, led by state Attorney General Phil Weiser. This was after Aurora District Attorney Dave Young declined to file any charges against the killers, then the city of Aurora opened a sham investigation led by a former cop which was terminated because it was plainly not ‚Äúindependent‚Äù.... Now it is up to Phil Weiser to decide whether the cops and paramedics responsible for Elijah‚Äôs death will face any criminal charges.

But just this week, Governor Polis quietly loosened the scope of the investigation, allowing Weiser to investigate for ‚Äúoffenses‚Äù, not just ‚Äúcriminal activity‚Äù related to Elijah‚Äôs death, opening up the possibility for him to come back with watered down charges against the killers, like we saw in Breonna Taylor‚Äôs case. Polis also took out the words that suggest someone caused the death of Elijah McClain.

Polis must think that the movement isn‚Äôt paying attention, that we‚Äôve been subdued by the repressive arrests of movement leaders, and now he can reel back his investigation without opposition in the streets. He is wrong.

Join us for an emergency action to make it clear that we are still here and we are not going anywhere until we get justice for Elijah McClain!

MASKS REQUIRED (OVER YOUR NOSE & MOUTH!) & PLEASE KEEP DISTANCE BETWEEN YOURSELF AND OTHERS.

item.title: Most inmates at the El Paso County jail weren‚Äôt given masks...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Most inmates at the El Paso County jail weren‚Äôt given masks until AFTER the jail became one of the state‚Äôs largest COVID-19 outbreaks when hundreds of inmates tested positive. Hundreds of people in shared living spaces had zero masks until last week.

The more than 1,200 inmates inside the El Paso County jail on any given day were not provided masks until last week, when the jail became the site of Colorado‚Äôs second-largest coronavirus out‚Ä¶

denverpost.com

El Paso County jail inmates weren‚Äôt given masks prior to one of Colorado‚Äôs largest COVID-19 outbreaks

item.title: Conditions are extremely difficult for our @denverpsl comrades inside.Lillian, Joel & Eliza are dealing with...
item.content:encoded: Conditions are extremely difficult for our @denverpsl comrades inside.Lillian, Joel & Eliza are dealing with difficulties accessing medication and sanitary products, serious COVID risks, abuse from guards, and intense stress from isolation (23+ hours a day). Their civil rights are also being violated with Denver, Adams and Arapahoe County working together to deny our comrades a bond hearing. Our comrades suffer yet they are still thinking of others — constantly telling communjty about the conditions of their cell mates and others in the jail and agitating for their release as well. @justiceforelijahmcclain PSL Denver and Say Their Names 5280 are heroes and freedom fighters. And we need to be fighting harder than ever for them. See you Saturday!
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver
